intro: Toubaouate, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with upright stems and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Toubaouate is also known for its ability to produce offsets, making it easy to propagate.
